intro: Eliokarmos richtersveldense, commonly known as the Richtersveld elokarmos, is a rare flowering plant native to the Richtersveld Conservancy in South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid, rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to store water and reduce transpiration. Due to its restricted habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered an endangered species.
